title: Sync Creatives Response
description: Response from creative sync operation. Returns either per-creative results (best-effort processing) OR operation-level errors (complete failure). This enforces atomic semantics at the operation level while allowing per-item failures within successful operations.

oneOf.title: SyncCreativesSuccess
oneOf.description: Success response - sync operation processed creatives (may include per-item failures)

dry_run.description: Whether this was a dry run (no actual changes made)

creatives.description: Results for each creative processed. Items with action='failed' indicate per-item validation/processing failures, not operation-level failures.

platform_id.description: Platform-specific ID assigned to the creative

changes.description: Field names that were modified (only present when action='updated')

errors.description: Validation or processing errors (only present when action='failed')

preview_url.description: Preview URL for generative creatives (only present for generative formats)

expires_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when preview link expires (only present when preview_url exists)

assigned_to.description: Package IDs this creative was successfully assigned to (only present when assignments were requested)

assignment_errors.description: Assignment errors by package ID (only present when assignment failures occurred)

^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$.description: Error message for this package assignment

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

oneOf.title: SyncCreativesError
oneOf.description: Error response - operation failed completely, no creatives were processed

errors.description: Operation-level errors that prevented processing any creatives (e.g., authentication failure, service unavailable, invalid request format)

items.title: Error
items.description: Standard error structure for task-specific errors and warnings

field.description: Field path associated with the error (e.g., 'packages[0].targeting')

retry_after.description: Seconds to wait before retrying the operation
